name: Whitley Hall Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night on the romantic break offer, some nice touches, like port and bubbly in the room. We stayed in a deluxe room but were disappointed that the bed was two singles put together. Although good quality and comfy beds, not very romantic! Beautiful countryside location, yet so close to meadow hall if you like shopping as well as a country walk. Dinner and breakfast very nice although wine stocks were low as the first 4 wines we chose they didn't have! I was also charged for a bottle of water I didn't get and the bill was £10 more than the price advertised at the time of booking earlier this year. Luckily both issues were sorted and refunded without a problem. Overall a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay on romantic break offer

reviews.text: Came here for a birthday meal and too be honest for what we got its well over priced.about twenty of us had a small room to ourselfs.i found the table to cramped with little space at either side.the room was average needs a lick of paint and remains of blu tack all over the wall.the service was okay.the meal was three course for £25 the starters were small but okay i had a disapointing bland yorkshire pud.the mains again only average at best and have had much better for less.the roast pots were overcooked on the outside and undercooked on the inside and some veg under cooked.also why such small veg portions ?...the sweet's were spot on i had a lovely choc mousse but overall for the money not good value at all.also the teas and coffees at the end were not included in the price and were £3.50 each now credit to the place they did not charge for them in the end..now to the bar very expensive £4.20 a watery pint of boddingtons and that was the cheaper option.the gardens are very nice to sit in.but overall for the price not good value...oh and the lad on the bar could do with some training as well.
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will definatly wil return. We stayed in room 5, which is on the front of the hotel. A warm summers evening so had the window open but was a little noisy. Especially our wake up call from the Milkman at 5.45am (The hotel needs to look at this remark). Loved the room, very comfortable and cosy. Excellent offer on glasses of Champagne. Dinner was a little dissapointing. Starter was very good but main course was a let down and slightly overpriced.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a one night 'Romantic Break' at the hotel. Dispite being within easy reach of Sheffield City centre and the M1 (Junction 35) it was surprisingly rural and quiet. Situated up a single track lane, the hotel's exterior is impressive and very well maintained. The building itself appears to have a new extension that is tastefully in keeping with the original part.
reviews.title: Good Value Night Away

reviews.text: Our room was described as superior and over looked the gardens and a small courtyard. It was ample in size with a a fair sized bathroom, containing a large bath, luxury! The package came with a bottle of pink fizz waiting for us on ice when we arrived and a small bottle of port. It also included dinner and breakfast. The food in the restaurant was good as was the wine choice, the service relaxed but attentive. There is a cosy bar area downstairs and had the weather been better we may have braved the garden for after dinner drinks, although as has been commented on by other reviewers, the prices are standard hotel ones so a bit on the pricey side. There was a wide choice at breakfast and again we experienced good service.
reviews.title: Whitley Hall Hotel

reviews.text: We came for a romantic break on one of their packages! It exceeded our expectations! The room was gorgeous, the grounds were beautiful and the food amazing!! Also because we booked a package it was really well priced!
reviews.title: Wish we had been earlier!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended and I can see why it makes a popular wedding venue!!
reviews.title: A Magical Afternoon in the Sunshine

reviews.text: Whitley Hall - from the outset is simply magical: the hotel, the grounds, the service, the food and the staff are second to none. We have just spent the most wonderful afternoon relaxing in the sunshine with a quintessentially English and totally scrumptious afternoon tea, served to us on a tiered cake stand in the stunning gardens, enhanced by the spectacular sight of Paddy the peacock in his full exquisite glory!
reviews.title: What a Surprise!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We cannot thank the staff (most notably Audrey, Angela and Jack) for their warm, welcoming, friendly smiles and for going that extra mile to make our day so special.
reviews.title: Better than average
Lovely lunch
reviews.text: We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - everything about it is just superb. Don't miss out!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I got married here this week and I can only describe the whole event as wonderful. This includes the food, service from all staff at the hotel and the organisation of the entire day. I would recommend that if you are looking for a wedding venue where the staff care for your big day look no further.The venue is beautiful.
reviews.title: Wedding day

reviews.text: I do not regularly write reviews but the whole experience was simply OUTSTANDING.
reviews.title: wedding day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many thanks to the entire staff.
reviews.title: Fabulous!
Amazing wedding day
reviews.text: excellent hotel and grounds perfect for a wedding,food was excellent,jak was lovely very polite and helpful,room was massive the bed was huge and comfy and peaceful everything was done on time for the wedding it went like clockwork would definately recommend this hotel

Beautiful grounds, beautiful hotel. Staff very helpful and attentive, could'nt do enough for us! Jack the manager and our receptionist was so lovely and helpful! The food was out of this world and the waiting staff were first class. We even had the best room service we've ever had and we have stayed in lots of hotels! We will be returning!! First Class!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel let down by poor service.

reviews.text: Gorgeous hotel surrounded by beautiful lawns with peacocks and a lake. We were wedding guests and stayed here overnight. I honestly can't fault this hotel, a very classy former manor house which has been sympathetically modernised keeping many of the original features. Our bedroom was tastefully decorated with reproduction fixtures and fittings, and even a signed limited edition Russell Flint picture on the wall. The bed was super king sized and had crisp white cotton sheets - also very comfy. I loved the bathroom with its oversized bath and its pretty ornaments. Everywhere spotlessly clean and the staff were attentive and friendly. I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: GREAT VENUE FOR A WEDDING 😊

reviews.text: Stayed one night with friends as a competition win - both rooms were in the newer part of the hotel - very comfortable beds, loved having a footstool as well as the two armchairs - appreciated the chilled bubbly on arrival - good variety of dishes on the menu, food well cooked and main courses structurally presented - service neither slow nor hurried. The lake was a lovely bonus to look out on from the bedroom and we enjoyed an after breakfast walk in the grounds the following morning. The staff were pleasant, professional and attentive. Would consider booking in again.
reviews.title: Weekend retreat with friends

reviews.text: we attended another wedding here, thats the 4th one in the last year, so we knew about the high bar prices, so im not going to complain about that, however what we didnt get this time which we did recieve the other times where a great staff service, reception was ok, but didnt really look like he knew what he was doing and therefore it got quite busy but we understand it might be new staff. we went up to our room and all was good and just like the other 3 times the room has been fantastic, nice and clean and has everything we needed, the service that i am talking about that realy didnt impress anyone was that off the bar staff, and the lack of interest that they showed to us and other customers. Now we are paying an excessive amount a pint and therefore dont expect to be served with a face that shouts that they dont want to be there. Iwould say there was 1 of the staff that knew what they were doing and therefore having to tell everyone else what to do aswell as pick up the slack and that was little danny, Isay little danny because the past 3times we have come its been danny d that has looked after us all, and we got to know him at the hotel and he always provided a high standerd of service and had a smile one his face, which we was expectin to see this time aswell, however we was found that he has left to another hotel. which is a great shame as he generated a great atmosphere,
reviews.title: looks good but service brought it down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Im not saying that its because he has left that the service has dropped because we only stayed one night and they might just be having an off day, however compared to when he was behind the bar, well there was no comparison everything was organised and everyone got served, and if a table had collapsed TWICE!!! he would have been out to sort it out.
reviews.title: Superb stay

reviews.text: there waitresses were however very nice and couldnt help enough, feel a bit dissapointed overall, and sorry for the bride and groom whose special day could have been better in my opinion.
reviews.title: Beautiful location- very unfriendly staff - disappointing to say the least. Had great expectations.

description: Whitley Hall is an ivy-clad 16th century mansion that provides an elegant and romantic setting for any occasion. Relax in this historic and fashionable hotel and enjoy the tranquil grounds of the surrounding estate. The hotel has recently benefitted from major refurbishment and offers extreme comfort throughout. The recently opened Parker wing offers rooms of the very highest standard, all of which have Juliet balconies and four deluxe bedrooms with lake views.
